Key Match Events: The Mavericks exploded for 36 points in the fourth quarter and ended the game on a 17-2 run.
Don't miss: P.J. Washington tapped into his clutch gene and drained the go-ahead corner 3-pointer to give Dallas a three-point lead.
Quentin Grimes sealed the victory after a three-point play
Pre-Game Insights: The game’s start time was moved up an hour due to snowy weather across the Metroplex.
Post-Match Reflections: With the win, the Mavericks have won their last two games without Luka Doncic and Kyrie Irving.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The first 5,000 fans in attendance who braved the weather conditions received Daniel Gafford pins.
Others: Jaden Hardy led the Mavericks by scoring a season-high 25 points, knocking down a season-high four 3-pointers in the second quarter.
Dereck Lively II added a season-high 21 points and a season-high 16 rebounds.
Portland Trail Blazers coach Chauncey Billups was well aware of Hardy’s recent surge from beyond the 3-point line entering Thursday’s game.
